text:
Raskolnikov stepped out of the room. 

"It all cuts both ways," he muttered. 

He descended the stairs, confidence swelling. 

"Now weâ€™ll make a fight for it," he smirked. 

Yet inside, shame gnawed at him. 

His malice turned inward, a reflection of his cowardice.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov leaves the room feeling more confident, despite his internal shame and contempt for his own cowardice.
